text:
Target understandings:

  • We can create instructions using block based programming
  • We can turn those instructions into electrical signals
  • We can turn those electrical signals (via an arduino) to mechanical output
  • We can put all the understandings above together to go fromWorld → Mechanical Input → Electrical Signal → Computer Logic → Electrical Signal → Mechanical Output → WorldIntroduction: So far, we have connected multiple circuits together and used logic in DataFlow to control how information flows from the outside world (potentiometer) to a virtual output. In this lesson, we will complete a similar procedure, to control a live output. In your workspace, brainstorm what kind of live (physical) outputs we can control with our programs.

Introduction

So far, we have connected multiple circuits together and used logic in DataFlow to control how information flows from the outside world (potentiometer) to a virtual output. In this lesson, we will complete a similar procedure, to control a live output.

 In your workspace, brainstorm what kind of live (physical) outputs we can control with our programs.
